intro: Ptilophora, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their soft, velvety leaves and showy, often yellow or purple flowers. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Ptilophora species are often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. The genus includes several species, some of which are considered invasive in certain parts of the world.
